alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Martin, southeastern Johnson, northeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Endicott, or near Prestonsburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gulnare around 455 PM EDT. Heenan, Moree and McClure around 500 PM EDT. Threeforks, Jarad, Laura, Piso and Coalpoint around 505 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Conder, Heisey, Hatfield Station, Varney, Rural, Turkey Creek, Whitepost, Sidney and Canada. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 11 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
